intro: Aporosa rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf aporosa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
